byline.contributor: Donald G. McNeil Jr. contributed reporting from New York, and Julie Hirschfeld Davis from Washington

abstract: Senate votes to allocate $1.1 billion in emergency funding to fight mosquito-borne Zika virus, less than $1.9 billion requested by White House; action shows compromise is possible in fraught election year, but also sets up fight with House Republicans who have advanced plan with just $622 million reallocated from other programs.
snippet: A total of $1.1 billion was approved, though the Obama administration had sought $1.9 billion. The action now sets up a confrontation with the House....
lead_paragraph: A total of $1.1 billion was approved, though the Obama administration had sought $1.9 billion. The action now sets up a confrontation with the House.

headline.main: Senate Votes to Advance Emergency Funding to Fight Zika Virus
headline.print_headline: Senate Votes to Advance Funds to Fight Zika Virus
